title: Im Done
body: Ive been playing league on and off for about 4 years now. I have never achieved anything decent (highest rank of Gold 3), but Ive still spent hundreds of hours playing the game and have spent hundreds of dollars on the game. Ive come to the realisation that this has been a complete waste, I feel since season 3 the game has devolved into something that has become utterly insufferable, Riot seems to be taking their game and the competitive scene less and less seriously. For example, the patch notes are now filled with stupid puns that I feel dont belong in something that is as serious as they should be. The patch notes determine the future of the game, one of the most important things Riot controls. I also used to watch every competitive game I could, but now the broadcasts spend 60% of the time either in waiting screens or talking about something that could be covered in half the time. I feel Riot have spent the last 18 months going down the wrong path with the game, this does not mean I know the right path or what path would be best for me to enjoy the game in the future, but with the way the game is now and the way its been heading I cant see myself ever coming back to League.

So because a game's patch notes aren't filled with technical jargons you think Riot is giving LoL less attention and thus now a waste of time?

If anything it's actually the opposite of that to be frank, lately they have been taking the game way TOO seriously.

If anything Riot have been making competitive play more serious especially in the LCS or other major league events, i have played for a long time aswell but i wouldnt say riot are taking the game less seriously. They need to add new features to the game to keep up with competitor moba games and to keep the league players intrested in the game. I do agree with the changes since season 3 have been very dramatic and they shouldnt have changed so much but its still a good game and i dont think you should quit now, or at least until any other big changes take place.

I think Riot has no problem keeping ahead of player count with the other MOBAs. Dota 2 has significantly less players at any one time than League. Strife is a bad game relative to league with its inferior gameplay and graphics. HoN probably takes the price for having one of the worst, most toxic chat atmosphere of any Moba game. Other Mobas are designed to specifically appeal to only casual players, it won't have the same respect given as LoL since it has already established a very profitable, enjoyable and popular professional scene. 
Smite is becoming better though, it still feels very clunky for traditional MOBAs so maybe it won't ever beat LoL or Dota 2.

You left out HotS that is pretty much bound to be at least somewhat successful riding on the name of Blizzard, and that Dawngate which was crushed by EA for whatever reason when it was actually doing quite well with its own spin on the formula.

Smite is the door to the new scene in MOBA/ARTS, as evident by the coming of Gigantic. In a way, Smite would become the next LoL/DotA in terms of status.

I think Smite will become very very popular, might even overtake League because as we grow old and influence the world, we League/traditional Dota 2 style MOBA players will eventually die out (leave the gaming scene) and the new generation will view Smite style as something that is better. They will value it more than League.
Who pooped in your cereal?

y so srs?

Gold tier is top 25% of players I'm pretty sure. That's something.

The jokes in patch notes are there to appeal to the more casual players. You can completely ignore them and read the real information. 
Riot has actually been placing much of their buffs and nerfs around competitive/higher tier (Gold+) matches, they rarely nerf champions that pubstomp in SoloQ below Gold. An example of an exception is Jax. Many people now believe he had a counter all along in S3 but people didn't pick them; Malphite and any supertanks that can withstand Jax's relentless damage and still be able to farm and be useful for the team.
People are saying Riven is very similar to Jax, can stomp SoloQ below Gold but is actually very counter-able.
I agree that they do patch the game with the intention of balancing it for higher levels of play but I think casual players arent going to read the patch notes.
